tool_description:
This is the official GPT-3 tokenizer, the same tokenizer is being used by OpenAI here https://platform.openai.com/tokenizer.
contact : um3r.it@gmail.com
name: GPT-3 Encoder & Tokenizer
title: GPT-3 Encoder & Tokenizer

api_list.name: Decode Tokens [from tokens to text]
api_list.description:
This endpoint is designed to convert a sequence of tokens back into their corresponding text format.
This endpoint accepts a list of token IDs as input and returns the original text representation of the tokens.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://gpt-3-encoder-tokenizer.p.rapidapi.com/decode"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "gpt-3-encoder-tokenizer.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://gpt-3-encoder-tokenizer.p.rapidapi.com/decode"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "gpt-3-encoder-tokenizer.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Encode & Get Number Tokens [from text to tokens]
api_list.description:
The following endpoint is highly useful as it provides the count of tokens. Additionally, it can also return the token IDs upon request. 
However, it is advisable to ***request token IDs only when required***, as it may increase the response time.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://gpt-3-encoder-tokenizer.p.rapidapi.com/encode"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "gpt-3-encoder-tokenizer.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
